verses.roman:
śiva-durgā rahe tāhāṅ brāhmaṇera veśe
mahāprabhu dekhi' doṅhāra ha-ila ullāse

synonyms: śiva-durgā—Lord Śiva and his wife, Durgā; rahe tāhāṅ—stayed there; brāhmaṇera veśe—in the dress of brāhmaṇas; mahāprabhu dekhi'-seeing Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; doṅhāra—of both of them; ha-ila—there was; ullāse—great pleasure.
translation: It was in Śrī Śaila that Lord Śiva and his wife Durgā lived in the dress of brāhmaṇas, and when they saw Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, they became very much pleased.
